member.name: DXGI_OFFER_RESOURCE_PRIORITY
member.summary: Identifies the importance of a resource’s content when you call the method to offer the resource.

member.name: DXGI_OFFER_RESOURCE_PRIORITY.DXGI_OFFER_RESOURCE_PRIORITY_LOW
member.summary: The resource is low priority. The operating system discards a low priority resource before other offered resources with higher priority. It is a good programming practice to mark a resource as low priority if it has no useful content.

member.name: DXGI_OFFER_RESOURCE_PRIORITY.DXGI_OFFER_RESOURCE_PRIORITY_NORMAL
member.summary: The resource is normal priority. You mark a resource as normal priority if it has content that is easy to regenerate.

member.name: DXGI_OFFER_RESOURCE_PRIORITY.DXGI_OFFER_RESOURCE_PRIORITY_HIGH
member.summary: The resource is high priority. The operating system discards other offered resources with lower priority before it discards a high priority resource. You mark a resource as high priority if it has useful content that is difficult to regenerate.
